alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 2:54PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Washington and central Clarke Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 254 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Saint Stephens, or 12 miles northeast of Chatom, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Jackson, Grove Hill, Saint Stephens and Leroy. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for southwestern Alabama.
